posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
We are trying to auto-align to the Apriltags on the reef in robot-relative coordinates, but I am having an issue with my limelight 3G. Here’s some context:

The camera is set up in the following configuration (relative to the robot’s center):

Yaw -90 degrees from the front

Roll 180 degrees (it’s upside down)

0.241 meters to the right of center

0 meters forward from center

PXL_20250117_033327655 1920×2550 244 KB

PXL_20250117_033327655 1920×2550 244 KB

PXL_20250117_033327655 1920×2550 244 KB

Here is how I loaded these values into the LL dashboard:

I am logging the Pose3d that the method LimelightHelpers.getTargetPose3d_RobotSpace() returns to get the tag in robot relative coordinates, but the data I get from the limelight looks like this (with the robot in the orientation above):

It appears that both the rotation and translation components of the pose are incorrect.

I am using LL 3G on 2024.10.1 (also tried on 2024.10.2) with the LimelightHelpers.java class from this commit: 61b39e679c616641fbc05879d77329a7826a7967

Am I doing this incorrectly? Thanks!!

Code:

feature-vision

Contribute to Team-190/2k25-Robot-Code development by creating an account on GitHub.
Do you remember to update your robot odom pose every loop cycle?

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Does the field pose matter if getting the pose in robot relative coordinates?

I am not sure, did you check their docs?

Introduced in 2024, Megatag2 is a precise and ambiguity-free AprilTag-based localizer for mobile robots. It was built with the following goals:

link_counts.title: Robot Localization with MegaTag2 | Limelight Documentation

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: It doesn’t say anything specific about needing to set the field relative pose for getting the tag pose in robot relative space. I just tested it with setting the pose and it didn’t work.

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Edit: added code link: GitHub - Team-190/2k25-Robot-Code at feature-vision

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
Here is what the robot looks like in the LL dashboard. It appears to be correct in this image.

posts.name: Prince Gill
posts.cooked:
Have you figured out the Issue?

Also the GitHub link doesn’t work

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: I’m not sure why, but updating to the 2025 image of LimelightOS fixed it.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
It’s because the field size changed in 2025, and limelight had hardcoded the field size previously.

Submit issues and feature requests over email or to the Limelight Feedback Repo

link_counts.title: Software Change Log & Feedback | Limelight Documentation

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Would that have effected the target pose in robot relative coordinates though? I thought that would have just effected the field relative coordinates.

suggested_topics.title: Limelight 3 restarting periodically
suggested_topics.excerpt: plugging the Limelight 3 to the 12V 2A slot on the VRM worked! The limelight now works flawlessly. Thank you everyone for your help!
